FuncDef: The display bgp vpn-target routing-table statistics command displays statistics about routes in the BGP-VPN-Target address family. The display bgp vpn-target routing-table statistics command displays statistics about routes in the BGP-VPN-Target address family.
CLIs: display bgp vpn-target routing-table { [ peer { <ipv4-address> | <ipv6-address> } { advertised-routes | received-routes } ] | [ origin-as <origin-as-num> ] } statistics
display bgp vpn-target routing-table { [ peer <ipv4-address> { advertised-routes | received-routes } ] | [ origin-as <origin-as-num> ] } statistics

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies an IPv4 address.
It is in dotted decimal notation.

Specifies an IPv6 peer address.

 NOTE: This parameter is supported only on the CE6863H, CE6863H-K, CE6860-SAN, CE6866K, CE6866, CE6860-HAM, CE6855-48XS8CQ, CE6885-SAN, CE8850-SAN, CE8855, CE8851-32CQ4BQ, CE8851K, CE8851-32CQ8DQ-P, CE8850-HAM, CE6881H, CE6881H-K, CE6820H, CE6820H-K, CE6820S, CE6885, CE6885-T, CE6885-LL (standard forwarding mode) and CE6863E-48S8CQ.
The value is a 32-bit hexadecimal string in format X:X:X:X:X:X:X:X.

Displays information about routes advertised to a specified peer.
-

Displays information about the routes received from the specified peer.
-

Displays information about RT routes with the specified origin AS number.
The value is an integer that ranges from 0 to 4294967295.

Examples: <HUAWEI> display bgp vpn-target routing-table peer 10.2.2.2 received-routes statistics
